header.title: Kissing lesbians told to ‘tone it down’ by Wetherspoon staff
header.postText: A lesbian couple say they had to leave a Wetherspoon pub after being told to ‘tone it down’ by a staff member for ‘cuddling and kissing’.', 'Hannah Clifford and Leoni Malbon-Barker, both 21, had gone for lunch at The Coronet in Holloway Road, Islington, on Wednesday.', 'Having not seen each other for a while, they hugged and kissed, but were left feeling shocked and vulnerable after a staff member approached them and told them to ‘tone it down’, the Evening Standard reported.', 'Ms Clifford told the paper that she ‘burst into tears’ as soon as she stepped outside the pub.', 'The couple were told that a customer had made a complaint about the pair ‘snogging each other’s face off’.', 'Ms Clifford to the Standard: ‘I had my arm around Leoni and had given her a cuddle and a kiss when we arrived because we hadn’t seen each other all day.', '‘But it was nothing raunchy because we were in public.’', 'They decided to leave after being made to feel ‘vulnerable and embarrassed’.', 'Both Ms Clifford and Ms Malbon-Barker, claim that as they left the pub, three men who they believe to be behind the complaint, made sexual gestures towards them on their way out and shouted ‘bye darlings’.', 'The couple decided to go back to the pub to submit a complaint to the manager and were offered a free breakfast in return, which they declined.', 'The manager is also reported to have offered to try and get the men banned.', 'Wetherspoon spokesman Eddie Gershon said: ‘A member of staff asked the couple to stop because they had received complaints from customers saying there was intimate, inappropriate touching under the table.', '‘They were fine with this at first and then decided to leave.', '‘As far as we are concerned, if a woman wishes to kiss a woman, or a man wishes to kiss a man in our pub, or any combination of that, that is fine by us.', '‘We are not sure of the background to this situation at The Coronet and it will be investigated.’
